properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Mount Martha.
  • There is a gas leak on Dorset Road.
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Follow the instructions of police and emergency services who are at the scene.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area:
  • You may smell gas.
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • The following road is closed: Dorset Road.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 19/10/2025 04:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - EXPLOSIVE HAZARD - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Dorset Road, Mount Martha
Issue Date: Sunday 19 October 2025, 01:51 pm
Next Update: Sunday 19 October 2025, 04:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38297/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Mount Martha.
- There is a gas leak on Dorset Road.


There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Drumborg, Kentbruck, Mount Richmond.
  • There is a bushfire at 10 kilometres North-NorthWest of Mount Richmond that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from South Kentbruck Track in a south-easterly direction.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 7pm yesterday, 18/10/2025.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.
  • Review your fire survival plan and implement if required. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Aircraft may be visible in the area. A reminder to not use drones in the area as this will cease firefighting operations. 
  • Firefighters are on scene and working to contain the fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 19/10/2025 04:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright.
  • Victoria Police advises the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues. 
  • Mount Buffalo National Park will partially reopen to the public on Tuesday 14 October, following advice from Victoria Police. 
  • There are some areas of the park that will remain restricted and members of the public will be prohibited from accessing.
  • The full details are available on the Parks Victoria website, with staff patrolling and signage displayed around the park.
  • Victoria Police advises those in the area to remain vigilant and report any suspicious behaviour to Triple Zero (000) or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. 
This Community Information replaces the message issued on Saturday, 11 October.
If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call Triple Zero (000) immediately and do not approach the offender. 
What you should do:
  • If you are in the Porepunkah area, you must follow instructions of emergency services at the scene.
  • Anyone who witnessed the incident or has any information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or www.crimestoppers.com.au.
Impacts in your area:
  • Road closures may change at short notice. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website for updates on road closures: traffic.transport.vic.gov.au.
This message was issued by Victoria Police.

The next update is expected by 21/10/2025 06:20 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency app
  • VicEmergency Facebook or Twitter
  • Victoria Police Facebook or Twitter
  • For more information, visit: Victoria Police - Porepunkah incident
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment, contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - DANGEROUS PERSON - Remain Vigilant Incident Location: Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright Issue Date: Tuesday 14 October 2025, 01:14 pm Next Update: Tuesday 21 October 2025, 06:20 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38252/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for the incident at Porepunkah and surrounding areas including Myrtleford and Bright. - Victoria Police advises the search for armed offender Desmond Freeman (Filby) continues. - Mount Buffalo National Park will partially reopen to the public on Tuesday 14 October, following advice from Victoria Police. - There are some areas of the park that will remain restricted and members of the public will be prohibited from accessing. - The full details are available on the Parks Victoria website, with staff patrolling and signage displayed around the park. - Victoria Police advises those in the area to remain vigilant and report any suspicious behaviour to Triple Zero (000) or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. This Community Information replaces the message issued on Saturday, 11 October. If you see Desmond Freeman (Filby), call Triple Zero (000) immediately and do not approach the offender.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Bolwarra, Curries, Gorae, Gorae West, Heathmere, Heywood, Mount Richmond, Cape Bridgewater, Cashmore, Drumborg, Portland North
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Mount Richmond to Portland, Cape Bridgewater and Heywood. 
  • There is a bushfire at 10 kilometres North-NorthWest of Mount Richmond that is not yet under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Aircraft may be visible in the area. A reminder to not use drones in the area as this will cease firefighting operations . 
  • Firefighters are on scene and working to contain the fire.
  • This Community Information replaces the previous message issued at 7pm yesterday, 18/10/2025.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
